CatDescriptText: Miss Vivian Mason, 7322 Monticello Street, partner in Mason's Cafe, 2130 Wylie Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 29, 1959, pg. A1 with question: Do you believe the state and city FEPC laws are helping Negroes to get jobs they never held before?" answer reads: "I think state and city FEPC laws are instrumental and an aid in helping Negroes get jobs they never had before. On the other hand, as active laws, I don't think they are very influential, due to my not having actual knowledge of any persons holding such jobs secured by these laws."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Vivian Mason wearing light colored short sleeved medallion patterned shirt, standing in front of building
